problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following is most likely to happen to \(EP\) (Expected Profit) if \(x \to ∞ \)? <<
( ) EP is zero. (x) EP goes to minus infinity. ( ) EP goes to a finite constant.
[explanation] \(x\) is the amount of newspaper, which is above or equal to zero. When \(x = 0\), \(EP\) is \(0\). When \(x \to +∞\), the first term of \(EP\) goes to a finite constant, the middle term goes to \( -∞\), and the last term goes to zero. Thus, when \(x \to ∞\) , \(EP \to -∞\). [explanation]
